mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The first described male Tube-web Spider for mainland Australia: Ariadna kiwirrkurra sp. nov. (Araneae: Segestriidae)

tax:treatment.tax:nomenclature: AnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnakiwirrkurraspeciesBaehr & WhyteAriadna kiwirrkurra Baehr & Whyte, sp. nov.(FIGURE 1 A–C, 2, 3 A–I, 4 A–F)

tax:p.tax:collection_event: 127.76139-22.865557AustraliaWestern AustraliaMaterial20150908B. BaehrholotypeMaterial examined. Holotype male (WAM-T138053) from Australia : Western Australia , Kiwirrkurra , SSS1, 22°51'56"S , 127°45'41"E , 449m , B. Baehr et.al., 8–18 Sep. 2015 , vertebrate traps .

tax:div.tax:p: Paratypes: 3 males (WAM-T138054) same as previous; 2 males (WAM-T138052),AnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnakiwirrkurraspeciesKiwirrkurra SSS2, 22°48'42"S, 127°49'52"E,436m, B. Baehr, et al.8–18 Sep. 2015,vertebrate traps; 1 male (QM-S96340) same as previous.

Etymology. The specific name is a noun in apposition taken from thetype locality.AnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnakiwirrkurraspeciesKiwirrkurra in the Gibson Desert is one of Australia's most recent Indigenous Protected Areas (IPA).

tax:figure.tax:p: FIGURE 1 (A–C). A Habitat ofAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnakiwirrkurraspeciesA. kiwirrkurra atAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnakiwirrkurraspeciesKiwirrkurra IPA in the Gibson Desert; B standard site SS1, C standard site SS2
FIGURE 2. Life image ofAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnakiwirrkurraspeciesBaehr & WhyteAriadna kiwirrkurra, Baehr & Whyte sp. nov. (photo: Robert Whyte).

tax:div.tax:p: Diagnosis.AnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnakiwirrkurraspeciesAriadna kiwirrkurra can be separated fromAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnadecatetracanthaspeciesMain, 1954A. decatetracanthaMain,1954 in having a fovea as an indented pit (AnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnadecatetracanthaspeciesA. decatetracantha has no fovea); fromAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnathyrianthinaspeciesSimon, 1908A. thyrianthinaSimon, 1908 by the oval opisthosoma (opisthosoma cylindrical inAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnathyrianthinaspeciesA. thyrianthina); fromAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnaburchellispeciesHogg, 1900Ariadna burchelli (Hogg, 1900) by the absence of any opisthosomal pattern (AnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnaburchellispeciesA. burchelli has an opisthosomal pattern); fromAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnaoctospinataspeciesLamb, 1911A. octospinata (Lamb, 1911) by PME in line of PLE (PME placed behind the line of PLE inAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnaoctospinataspeciesA. octospinata) and fromAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnadysderinaspeciesL. Koch, 1873A. dysderinaL. Koch, 1873 by the round PME (PME oval inAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnadysderinaspeciesA. dysderina).AnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnakiwirrkurraspeciesA. kiwirrkurra can be separated from the remaining non mainland AustralianAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnagenusAriadna species, in having the long paturon forward directed with lateral condyle; and a large globular palpal bulb at least twice the diameter of the tibia.

Description. Male (Holotype, WAM-T138053). Total length 7.18. Prosoma 3.72 long, 2.84 wide, pl/pw 1.31; sternum 2.55 long, 1.29 wide, sl/sw 1.97, nearly2 x as long as wide; opisthosoma 3.46 long, 2.56 wide. Eyes, anterior eye row narrower than posterior eye row; lateral and median eyes contiguous; eyes arranged in 3 closely spaced diads; PME largest; ALE 0.18; PME 0.19; PLE 0.18; ALE-ALE 0.33; PME-PLE 0.13. Clypeus 0.14 high. Prosoma dark brown, oval, reticulated, posteriorly concave (Fig. 3 A), sides rebordered and slightly undulated, fovea an indented pit.

Chelicerae dark brown, directed forward; paturon twice as long as wide with lateral condyles, promargin with 3 (Fig. 4 B), retromargin with 1 tiny tooth, fangs short directed medially (Fig. 4 A). Endites, labium, medium brown, tips of endites white (Fig. 4 B); sternum pale sides darker (Fig. 3 A); opisthosoma oval, dark brown without any pattern; venter medium brown, booklungs pale (Fig. 38). Endites: serrula a single row of teeth (Fig. 3 D). Legs robust, yellow; leg I, II: distal part of femur, patella and tibia dark brown; metatarsus I with prolateral tubercle (Fig. 3 F, 4C, D), superior tarsal claw I and II with about 13 teeth (Fig. 4 E), claw III and IV with about 7 medially situated teeth (Fig. 4 F), inferior claw tiny, without teeth (Fig. 4 F). Tarsus IV ventrally swollen (Fig. 4 F). Leg formula: II-I-IV-III. Leg measurements: I, femur 3.36, patella 1.15, tibia 2.90, metatarsus 2.60, tarsus 1.02, total 10.13; II, 3.07, 1.26, 2.75, 2.73, 0.93, 10.74; III, 2.54, 0.73, 1.72, 1.66, 0.85, 7.50; IV, 3.17, 1.08, 2.33, 1.98, 0.96, 9.16. Leg spination (only surfaces bearing spines are listed): I: femur d1-1-1, p3ap,dr1ap; patella p1ap; tibia p1-1-1-1-1, vp2-2-2-1, vr1-1-1-1, r1-1-1-1-1-1-1; metatarsus p1-0-0-1, r1-0-0-1; II: femur d1-1-1-1, dp2ap,dr2ap; tibia p1-1-1, vp1-1-1, vr1-1-1-1, r1-1-1-1-1-1-1; metatarsus p1-1-1,v1, r1-1- 1-1; III: femur d1-1-1-1, dp2ap,dr2ap; tibia p1-1-1,v1, r1-1-1-1; metatarsus p1-1-1,v1, vr1-1, r1-1; IV: femur d1-1-1-1- 1; metatarsus r1. Male palp (Figs 3 G-I): cymbium short, dorsally indented about as long as wide, covered with black setae (Fig. 3 H); large globular palpal bulb twice the diameter of the tibia (Figs 3 G, I), embolus long and thin; tip s-shaped (Figs 3 G, I).
Distribution. Known only from theAnimaliaArachnidaAraneaeSegestriidaeAriadnakiwirrkurraspeciesKiwirrkurraIPA in the Gibson Desert inWesternAustralia (Fig. 1 A–C).
